bow: when does the regret go away my daughter is 12 weeks old she was planned in fact we spent years trying to get pregnant before we did my husband was the driving force behind having children he made that clear from the start and it would have been right to marry him if was prepared to have that life she so much hard work if knew then what know now when does this feeling of regret go away people have told me this feeling is normal but hate feeling it and want light at the end of the tunnel and to know that ll one day be glad that we have her it worth noting that my husband feels the same way do and also we ll not be having another even though the original plan was to have kids are you guys able to have couple time or at the very least have some me time get overwhelmed my daughter will be weeks but if make sure spend some time doing something by myself taking bath mucking around on facebook etc for bit everyday do feel quite so overwhelmed do you have family that could step in to help found it really really hard until sleep trained my baby at weeks then it was like weight had been lifted suddenly really could nap when she napped shower etc because she wasn attached to me while she napped there were definitely still tough days it also generally got better at months and love the sitting and crawling stage making point of going out every day also helped go to the gym every day with daycare hr and 15 minutes to myself helped me recharge you are seriously almost there hate to admit felt that way because we struggled and did ivf for our little guy but for the first 10 12 weeks honestly cried nearly every day and was terrified that we had ruined our lives at 12+3 suddenly could put him down for 30 minutes and he could sleep on his own we could put him in the rock play and he would sleep for few hours at time at night and then gradually over the next few weeks he became fun honestly believe that infertility can be traumatizing and as result those of us who went through it are more at risk for ppd and ppa are you talking to someone on any medication getting on small dose of fluoxetine made such difference you re in really brutal period right now but promise it gets so much better life with 4+ month old is ridiculously easy compared to life with month old please hang in there it going to get better but also please reach out and talk to someone if you are already agree with everyone comments it really does get easier the moment they start to show you personality you will forget that regret just remember that everything passes described the first few months as being in fog because ur trying to learn something very new very fast the baby will not need you as much as it has your husband will also find his groove make sure he is helping you with everything he can do he too can bond and learn what the child needs in my experience it pays off later and he will be able to help with out asking you what to do take deep breath shower and few minutes to your self everytime you need it thank you for such lovely and hopeful comment talk about it with my husband he keeps apologising for being the driving force behind having her bless him she exclusively breast fed which is one of the reasons that this is not fun ride as it been so problematic and she not good feeder so reluctant to take antidepressants even if told that it ok it just does sit right with me was on similar antidepressant before we decided to try for baby was so against the idea of having it in my system when pregnant that came off them months prior to starting trying and stayed off them for the while two years as well as the pregnancy itself truly hope she gets easier she has me up every hour in the night getting her down for nap is hard work like said she not good feeder glad things got better for you xx lucky enough to have my mum close by my me time consists of much needed naps or housework ve not taken bath since she was born do spend lot of time on fb though it something to do while she breastfeeding at night since we do this lying down in my bed so hands free my husband and do even sleep in the same bed anymore our relationship is fine she just up so often that he be knackered the next morning for work do miss sleeping in the same bed as him we get bit of couple time when my parents look after the baby every now and then it is normal my hubby and adore our baby but sometimes it is so full on we have often thought why didn we wait longer our daughter has not been an easy baby months get little easier 6months you feel relief because they start sitting up and they are so happy with them selves 10 months is even easier because they usually are crawling and it isn as hands on 12 months is dream my little one is trying to walk now and it adorable it as if all the crazy hard times are melting away and being replaced with joy she played by herself for hrs this morning and fell asleep with cuddle have you looked into the wonder weeks it saved my sanity how did you sleep train your baby can you at least talk to someone even if you do feel ok with anything in your system even just having place to unload can do so much for your mental health people act like breastfeeding is no big deal but omfg have never felt so ambivalent about anything in my life exclusively pump now that back to work and dude is not into nursing but when was home it was 5hour cluster feeding sessions interspersed with baby screaming and failing to latch always thought be able to just do formula but then as soon as there was an actual baby honestly felt like had no value if could breastfeed really wish started talking to someone earlier my neighbor has baby with feeding issues and in awe of how much she soldiered on through you re dealing with something so incredibly stressful of course you re exhausted and needing to see the light it sounds like you ve been working so so hard to do your best for your precious little baby what great mother you are already you re on the precipice of things getting better one day you ll turn to your husband and you ll say remember when we used to and it was so hard and it ll simultaneously feel like just yesterday but also lifetime ago wish could be there in person you re doing such wonderful job and very soon you ll stop worrying that you ll regret this wish that when had my 10 week old who had to be held 24 hours per day that could have had chance to look into the future at myself only few weeks later kissing all over his face as he kicked his feet and shrieked with happiness my husband and are one and done do think could do the first months again but so so glad got through them with this guy fortunately my husband is head and shoulders above most fathers that hear about in that he intuitive and proactive when it comes to her care and mine he just works full time and does have lot of free time ☹️ that gives me hope thank you ve heard of wonder weeks sounds like it worth buy thank you you ve definitely had time with it yourself very much share your thoughts on breastfeeding it been such hard work but ve made it this far which makes it harder to ditch it for formula at this stage lol soldiering on is definitely what doing too plagued by persistent nipple thrush so effectively breastfeeding from just one boob and expressing from the other you ve made me feel lot better thank you please feel free to pm me anytime lt thank you very much appreciate that xxx at weeks my body hurt so bad and my nerves were frayed so thin borrowed tammy hogg secrets of the baby whisperer and sped read it started incorporating her advice before had even finished reading the book she recommends few things that many parents told me about in recommending her and that helped me wade to the surface of despair the easy schedule in which eating particularly nursing is separate from sleeping eat activity awake sleep yourself this was game changer for me had been nursing my baby to sleep resulting in my often being under her with her attached for hour she also recommends dark rooms white noise swaddling pre nap bedtime routine and pick up put down the latter kinda worked but in the end my kid often ended ramped up from my coming in and trying to soothe her she just needed to be left to sort herself out do recommend the book she has good examples of couples she helped and she shows just how much diligence it takes you have to be 100 committed and consistent by day my baby was falling asleep for naps and bedtime much faster than day from 45 minutes of protesting to 10 ve since read ferber solve your child sleep problems karp happiest baby on the block and obleman sleep sense liked the science in ferber but his intermittent check system like hogg pick up put down method did not work for my baby karp has good advice but it more geared toward the cranky colicky baby and my baby was generally happy obleman was probably the best in terms of supporting parents to do what they need to do about the crying but giving good advice that was easy to follow in other regards that really good to hear about your husband you both just have to allow yourselves all the emotions then your body is still going threw lot and he prolly just trying to figure out how he can take care of you both which is over whelming for anyone just remember to take care of your self not sure if your getting out of the house but if not so much practice going out and add on something each time till feel comfortable getting out in the world shopping parks resturants etc helps to make you feel more normal the more you do the more you wont think twice about the difference from the time before child and now honestly hated motherhood up until about months in did feel like hit my stride until about months when my daughter stopped crying nonstop and started being happy outside my arms and off my boob putting her to bed for the night at helps we are both naturally early birds so early night early morning works well for us get bit of time with my husband between putting her to bed and going to sleep myself and it helps lot to keep us feeling connected also try to keep up with my running it gives me something to do that is only for me you are kind of in the thick of some tough stuff some people are just not baby people and that okay babies are lot of really hard work and promise you with each new season they get more and more fun my husband is so not baby person but as our daughter has gotten older he has enjoyed her more and more you ll get there it starts to fade in my opinion when they become more interactive and less of just ball of bodily function for me this was at about 10 12 months for each of my boys it ok mama you re just holding onto life as you knew it before baby arrived it normal which does make it any easier resisted my first son this way until he was almost wish could have gotten over myself sooner but it unique path we all have to travel on our own also have you looked up info on high needs babies our daughter is definitely high needs and reading dr sears info on his own high needs daughter was like breath of fresh air suddenly we were the only ones in the whole world without compliant potato baby seriously this child is exhausting but seeing her personality as something to embrace rather than fight has made difference in how we approach her fussy periods things get substantially easier and more enjoyable around the month mark say and then another big shift around year by the time she two think you ll be enjoying the crap out of her by then you might even decide it all been worth it and go for another smiles and babble really helped me for me it was little different kept saying he such an easy baby it fine and somewhere around or months just stood stock still in the kitchen and went wow that really wasn easy or fine at all things tend to get better before you realize they have if that makes sense my guess is you ll turn around one day and go wow ve been feeling really good lately actually every little bit of progress especially the smiles and interaction really helped you ve got this it so hard in the beginning the first months were really rough for us we had colicky baby and did understand why it was so hard for us thought parenting would be easy and feel natural we tried for 5+ years and struggled with multiple losses felt so awful feeling the way did it gets better you ll still have hard days here and there but it ll get easier hang in there do you have bed time routine my little girl did sleep through the night until we started routine pick bed time give your baby bath feed before after sing lullaby and put the little down to sleep it helped us to have sound machine ours plays beach noises and has soft light with slowly moving fish that slowly gets quieter and dimmer until it turns off you do have to do bath every night if your baby does like it but something the baby can expect will lead to bedtime and make them sleepy should help you can also try baby lotion or soap with lavender it may seem like small thing to adults but the scent really is soothing good luck we also ended up supplementing with formula at four weeks because was going nuts actually called my doctor office one morning saying needed help because could take it pretty sure it did contribute to my milk stopping at six months but my husband taking over one night feeding so could sleep for four to six hours really helped it sounds like you are struggling with symptom of postpartum depression talk to your doctor you are not alone momma its just hard thing to talk about will say that my son years old now was incredibly difficult he too was exclusively breastfed up until months and he never slept when say never mean never he would feed every hours and fall asleep at the breast when put him down he would wake up and scream it was awful look back now and know had some ppd as my husband was as clueless as was his response was to pull away completely and leave me to do it all alone he did leave us but honestly expecting him to help and him never helping was worse fast forward years and have an week old daughter who is the easiest most laid back baby have ever experienced looked back and realized how had wished my sons infancy away and my husband and decided to have another baby we were terrified but you know what changed did was so much calmer with my 2nd pregnancy and knew what to expect with my son cut out coffee and did all the right things with my daughter if wanted sushi ate it took that tylenol when needed it didnt give up my coffee etc felt prepared to handle the constant crying because mentally knew it was coming and knew how fast it really does pass and guess what she sleeps hour stints since weeks old if you do want another baby no one on earth would fault you for that just know every baby really is different and sometimes the circumstances being different are all it takes the other responders are right you are almost there once they can hold their head up and start eating some solid foods it gets so so much easier and fun honestly it does commend you for being honest with yourself and your husband about your feelings hang in there you are so so close to the good stuff when my child started entertaining herself about five months or so by six months it had gone away entirely that was also about the time my child stopped randomly crying or whining for hours at time no matter what we did but we re one and done never doing birth or those first few months again also sleep deprivation makes everyone less happy once actually got unbroken sleep was like different person even though really thought had gotten used to 90 minute chunks of sleep it was like getting my soul back after slept every night for week legitimately ca emphasize that enough for real though get tubal ligation or iud or have him get vasectomy if you re serious about being one and done we knew we were in that boat when she was just few months old and she good kid it just kids are lot of work this was me every day of my month maternity leave actually just got done telling my husband how felt like bonded with her for real this week had days off and for the first time didn get sick of her still kinda hated the chore of feeding her and putting her to bed but man do adore all of her she months say it been gradual slow burn for me but there and she awesome still don love being mother but really really love this thing made not about to make another but don regret this one it sounds like you have major ppd hope you re seeing therapist or taking the appropriate medication months for me for my first once he could sit up and interact more and play had bit more baby blues with the second so more like months say we are months now and she is starting to crawl towards me and it is just so heart wamrong when they reach out towards you yeah this person worries me everyone kept telling my while was pregnant get through the first months honestly think it more like months my son is 10 months now that he is feeding himself and able to play alone or even just sit back and watch show life is so much easier some people are just not baby people and that totally ok have friend who hated the newborn stage felt regret but now her baby is and she loves him more than anything and truly really enjoys being his mom don beat yourself up over it it gets better me or op gt she exclusively breast fed which is one of the reasons that this is not fun ride as it been so problematic and she not good feeder breastfeeding is great but it also ok to combo feed or switch to formula my little one was in the nicu for while and had tongue tie long story short we ve been combo feeding since day and it fine replacing few feeds with bottles or supplementing each feed if you have low supply is fine obviously if eff is important to you stick with it but baby needs happy healthy mom more than they need breast milk if you are seriously distressed like you describe it time to pull out all the stops and do what you need to do to stay sane your mental physical health is important too and it has big impact on your baby well being yes had preemie and it was so hard to pump and he could latch because he was so small eventually my supply was gone so had to switch to formula breastfeeding was so bad for my mental health but could see it because was trying so hard to be good mom after my body failed and he was born so soon but formula has been godsend wish could have ebf but that was in the cards for us and that okay it got better for me around month stopped breastfeeding because of lack of supply but also she started mostly sleeping through the night and in separate room that was big game changer it feels like this is going to go on forever but it wo you ll be okay also one and done mom but my daughter continues to grow up into really good kid so am happy chose this life if you feel more depressed than not there is nothing wrong with seeking help either months to sleep 18 months to breathe and 5+ is just the funnest most awesome time didn want kids but didn want an abortion when it happened very glad did it now you re almost over the hump hang in there it totally normal to feel that way if someone says otherwise they re lying that what parenthood is all about the sweet and the bitter personally co slept and it made our lives so much better we all got more sleep which in turn allowed us to be better people to each other including the kid she lost interest in co sleeping at about 22 months so we ve got our marital bed back but being well rested was worth it it gets better think months is turning point with crawling and sign language and new foods and when she starts walking and talking around year it ll be whole new world in terms of work it starts to taper off around and by they can be quite independent if you teach them the skills they need by 10 she ll be doing your dishes and helping with the laundry walking the dog vacuuming the living room mowing the lawn you wo know what you ever did without her kids are so useful once they have some skills it gets better promise removed hey my wife and had really hard time with our daughter for the first two weeks we also exclusively breastfed she screamed all afternoon and into the night if she wasn on the breast she was crying she would sleep little and wake up crying she wasn gaining much weight came to find out that my wife wasn producing much milk after noon so our daughter was having to nurse constantly from about pm to am every day and still wasn getting enough the game changer was giving up on ebf once we talked to our pediatrician who used formula for both her kids and told us that the benefits of exclusively breastfeeding are fairly fuzzy most of the science compares exclusively breastfeeding vs exclusively using formula but there isn anything that really shows that ebf is better than supplementing we started supplementing with formula in the afternoons and evenings it is awesome our daughter is so much happier and more interactive can share more of the parenting with my wife my wife doesn feel like her entire relationship with our daughter revolves around having her soul sucked out through her nipples we can trade off so right now my wife is sleeping 10 pm to am and am sleeping am to am our daughter is gaining weight think about it there was time when my son was few weeks old were was sitting on the couch 3am feeding him with bottle unsuccessfully and he was shrieking without apparent cause in my face would have given him back to the hospital never to see him again for an extra hour of sleep around months when he started crawling making actual noises other than shrieks of god awful terror and laughing at my stupid facial expressions that began to love him like really really love him we just had our second weeks ago and while dreading the first months am excited to see what kind joyous little girl she will soon become there is this thing called type fun it where in the moment you re like this sucks never again but when you look back on it it the best thing ever having kids is like that you always look back on things with fond memories had so many breakdowns and can do this moments at first almost months into this mom thing and can proudly say that finally getting the hang of it 36 and am so envious of all those moms that had their children when they were younger and had energy it so tough some days barely have the energy to get up and make cup of coffee but as soon as see that little guy smiling at me my god my heart melts and the happiest person on the planet you ll get there you ll have your gushing moment you ll look back and say wow time has flown find myself wondering if want to do it again then think nuts lol my little guy is halfway through his 6th month and he fantastic he an early roller and crawler but ust yesterday decided to take sitting seriously his personality is really coming out his sleep is perfect but getting what need now feeling pretty good with antidepressant meds for ppd at 12w was still not feeling entirely human hang in there think you re in unique position as well because on top of the normal post part stress and regret you feel you also are feeling an extra layer of guilt because you should be grateful we struggled for years and couldn get pregnant so we adopted we went through so much to have our son in our arms the first night at the hotel from the hospital was the worst night of my life have never felt such deep regret was mortified cried along with him all night what had we done couldn be mother for the next two weeks was in constant fear and terrified also felt so guilty because we had worked so hard to finally be parents had vented about women that complained about being moms and now was one of them post partum depression and anxiety doesn care how badly you wanted that baby it comes like freight train even after gave birth to my biological daughter still had severe ppd and knew to get on medication quickly if you re not comfortable taking anything understand but would urge you to speak with your doctor for now though you re in the trenches around 12 weeks life starts to get easier my sister gave me phenomenal advice when struggled with the nights she told me to move everything into the living room keep snacks and water available turn on netflix and pretend 2am was 2pm stopped trying to get baby back to sleep looked at the middle of the night like it was the afternoon it worked wonders on my mental health eat meal and enjoy baby snuggles also some others have commented breastfeeding is great formula feeding is also great but you don have to choose sides you do not need justification to combo feed if you wanted to give her bottle of formula tomorrow just so you could take break for one feeding go for it think it important she have good full belly and it okay to breastfeed and occasionally add in formula hang in there momma you got this felt the same way with both my sons it hard becoming parent you re taking on new identity keeping another person alive that is mega stressful and overwhelming missed my old life being able to sleep whenever wanted go out with my husband for couple drinks everything loved my son but felt like that bond was as instant as expected it to be it was until he was eating solids and crawling at months that things started to get fun then they start to walk and talk and even do things for themselves that you used to do and you find yourself missing the younger days it becomes more rewarding with every passing day mama hang in there we both said those first couple years we only have one and the thought of having another baby was far too overwhelming considering the amount of emotional and physical sacrifice it can be but this past year just after my son turned we had our second son and so glad we did even though knew what to expect those first few weeks still had the same feeling and fears return did we make mistake will my son think love his baby brother more remember our first night home from the hospital my older son awoke in the middle of the night to growing pains in his leg and came into my room as was awake feeding the baby he did know was second this my older one always had bath feed bed and by eight weeks was more or less sleeping through my second it was like forgotten what had worked before wasn doing the routine and she would scream every evening like she was in pain one day just put her down to bed for break for ten minutes and she fell asleep after that kept her to routine and she began sleeping too this next one is going straight into routine haha obviously all babies are different and it may not necessarily work so well for everyone but when it does it magic what you are feeling to an extent is normal look at it this way when meeting new friend you do typically click right away you do know what they like or do like you re not sure of what makes them happy nor what really grinds their gears you are creating relationship with tiny human that has no fucking clue how to explain their needs rather than crying hysterically this is the worst this is the head down in the line of fire and hoping for the best it will get better promise my first child was unicorn she was laid back easy going loved to cuddle just total unicorn of child my son if he was my first child he would ve been my last he cried for 8+ hours day colic reflux general hate for his parents he had it all but once we hit months he became this child that would laugh and smile he would interact with us we found routine we finally started understanding each other it hard frustrating mentally and physically exhausting but it does get better if you have any doubts if you can get through it safely talk to your doctor ppd isnt something to mess with was so severely depressed after complete months of crying thought was loosing my mind my dr helped me out we eventually found things that worked just remember mama it does get better as tough as it is now this tiny human is here because of you you created tiny resilient sometimes stubborn strong willed child and they will flourish in the years to come because of you glad this worked for you don get me wrong but just want to set few things straight the thing with breastfeeding is supply and demand the only thing that gets more milk is baby on breast it takes about days to increase supply when baby needs more you just get through it for me it was cuddling breastfeeding in bed most of the day while watching netflix and my husband brought me food it doesn have to be soul sucking but it can be and of course mother mental health is important it takes about months to firmly set in good milk supply and from then on breastfeeding is walk in the park for most women until then it crucial to feed on demand and as long as it takes it helps not to have pacifier until then if you want to avoid feeding problems it not crime to supplement but then you need to express the same amount to keep up your supply every time otherwise you are telling your body to make less then the baby needs it normal for babies to be more nervous in the afternoon most formula fed babies are as well but glad switching helped you out just wanted to explain it doesn have to breastfeeding certainly has benefits and the boob is amazing it soothes feeds loves and puts to sleep but of course you can have an amazing connection with out is as well this is what ve learned from lactation consultants that helped me to keep breastfeeding and to make it into pleasant experience not soul sucking as you ve aptly put it now still breastfeeding my 15months old and really glad we made it good luck to you between years for me but we had an extremely high needs baby then toddler with speech delay stopped having moments of regret when he started to understand more of what we were saying and started to be able to express his needs it does get better would trade him for the world now it took me about year you ll get there it worth it hang in there for me it got lot better after we figured out how to put her down and let her fall asleep on her own self soothing is key and sleep training made huge difference we referred to the book sleep problems forgot the author but it the go to book on sleep training didn realize we could ve done it earlier and that months is actually the latest one should do it if you want to make it an easy learning curve our lo went from waking up times night to sleeping through the night within week of course she now regressed again to waking up on average once night good luck and hang in there there is some science that says minimal amount of ssri in your system is not problematic for the baby talk to your doctor he she will know what dose will work for you without harming the baby you can not be good mom without taking care of yourself the antidepressants will help pull you out of this funk and help you see the light at the end of the tunnel you will both benefit from you taking care of you can you point me towards this slowly moving fish thing breastfeeding was hell for me as well until all the sudden in his fourth month he started eating perfectly like he was doing it that way all along was really sad too because everyone said it gets easier at weeks yeah not even close ve been there and made it out the other side my sons are and and they are loads easier to interact and take care of now you are right in the thick of it and it is very hard have you thought about pumping once or twice during the day so that your husband can give her bottle at night did that with both of my sons after establishing my supply and it made huge difference in my mood getting just that bit more sleep when she about 18 months to years she will probably go through by self revolution and you will marvel at her trying to get spoon in her mouth put her shoes on backwards and grabbing the broom to sweep with you right now she more of grub but before you know it she will become her own independent person you breastfed for three months that great accomplishment with my oldest made it two painful months before realizing that breastfeeding was robbing me of enjoying this time with my baby finally decided to switch to pumping only and supplementing withe formula omg best day of my life removed can say ever felt any sense of regret but until my first was about eight months old couldn even fathom the notion of having another child but it gets easier and things slowly go back to normal even if it takes couple years actually thought the second was far easier it helps to know what you re doing already you re in the worst part was so miserable back then for us it started getting slowly but steadily better around months you ll find your groove you ll know each other better and know how to work with her you ll be less tired hint have look at sleeptrain she ll hit milestones sitting up crawling you ll notice that she understands so much even though she ca speak yet remember mine was 10 months and my husband said time for your bath sweetie she frigging climbed down the couch crawled to the bathroom and tugged on her shirt all on her own we were standing there dumbfounded it was awesome before that you ll get baby kisses baby kisses are open mouth kisses where they try to eat you with love they are awesome around that time you ll put her bottle next to her and before you can sit down to feed her she ll pick it up and put it in her mouth and look so proud of herself and you ll melt few months after that you ll tell her it almost dinner time she ll grin and say pasta and it will be the most meaningful conversation ever then she ll walk and you ll see her toddler running towards you because you re the best person in the whole world then you ll have private jokes but right now it hell it one of the most taboo subjects in parenting the first months are hell people cry so so much people regret it so so much very vocal about it with my future parent friends do sugarcoat anything because believe they need to know wish had known was so miserable and it was even worse because thought was the exception yeah right happy parents are the exception hang in there we re there for you and it going to get so much better very soon don know if someone already mentioned it but had the same feelings and the game changer was pumping between breastfeeding so that my husband could assist with feeding and could get more sleep my lo never latched well and breastfeeding was always struggle nipple shield etc yes eventually she wanted the bottle only which was hard but was able to exclusively pump and she was essentially ebf until weaning at 13 months know that you are not alone it gets so much better once they become mobile they usually become much happier and easygoing my son was planned and we didn leave that phase until recently and he turn next month he is autistic and very speech delayed so think that contributed to the feeling lingering longer than normal hate this stigma that if you do breast feed you must not be good natural mother say screw that pumped did what could and after awhile the milk dried up and we did formula pumping is amazing in two ways your child is still getting your milk but now you know how much they are getting two daddy can help feed too it took two to create this baby it gon na take two to raise it was able to get additional sleep and so was my husband because we took turns and we knew she had full belly that baby is still getting loved on when you hold it to feed them even did the skin to skin sometimes when fed my kids it is ok to try modern advances removed it gets easier around or at least that been with experience with my daughter the couple of months after the birth was
